results.title: Vascular effects of simvastatin combined with ramipril in hypercholesterolemic patients with coronary artery disease, compared with simvastatin alone: a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, crossover study.
results.text_hl: However, @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ combined with @CHEMICAL_Ramipril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017257 @@@ramipril@@@ changed to greater but statistically insignificant extent the percent flow-mediated dilator response to @<m>DISEASE_Hyperemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006940 @@@hyperemia@@@ and plasma levels of @CHEMICAL_Nitrates @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009566 @@@nitrate@@@, @CHEMICAL_3_4_Methylenedioxyamphetamine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D015104 @@@MDA@@@, @GENE_CCL2 @GENE_6347 @@@MCP-1@@@, and @GENE_SERPINE1 @GENE_5054 @@@PAI-1@@@ antigen than @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ alone.

results.title: Microvascular Reactivity and Endothelial Function in Type 2 Diabetic Patients with Hyperlipidemia Treated with Simvastatin: 3-year Follow-up.
results.text_hl: Maximal perfusion (max), velocity of perfusion increase (max/t) and percent increase of perfusion compared to baseline (%) was measured during @<m>DISEASE_Hyperemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006940 @@@post-occlusive reactive hyperemia@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Hyperemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006940 @@@PORH@@@) and @<m>DISEASE_Hyperemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006940 @@@thermal hyperemia@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Hyperemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006940 @@@TH@@@).

results.title: Simvastatin combined with ramipril treatment in hypercholesterolemic patients.
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Ramipril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017257 @@@Ramipril@@@ alone or @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ combined with @CHEMICAL_Ramipril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017257 @@@ramipril@@@ significantly improved the percent flow-mediated dilator response to @<m>DISEASE_Hyperemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006940 @@@hyperemia@@@ (both P<0.001), however, @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ combined with @CHEMICAL_Ramipril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017257 @@@ramipril@@@ showed significantly more improvement than @CHEMICAL_Ramipril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017257 @@@ramipril@@@ alone (P<0.001 by ANOVA).

citations.NLM: Koh KK, Son JW, Ahn JY, Kim DS, Jin DK, Kim HS, Han SH, Seo YH, Chung WJ, Kang WC, Shin EK. Simvastatin combined with ramipril treatment in hypercholesterolemic patients. Hypertension. 2004 Aug;44(2):180-5. PMID: 15184351

results.title: Comparative effects of statin and fibrate on nitric oxide bioactivity and matrix metalloproteinase in hyperlipidemia.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Fenofibrate @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011345 @@@fenofibrate@@@ significantly improved the percent flow-mediated dilator response to @<m>DISEASE_Hyperemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006940 @@@hyperemia@@@ by 183+/-41% and by 30+/-7%, respectively (each P<0.001); however, @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ significantly improved more (P<0.001).

citations.NLM: Koh KK, Ahn JY, Jin DK, Han SH, Kim HS, Choi IS, Ahn TH, Shin EK, Jeong EM. Comparative effects of statin and fibrate on nitric oxide bioactivity and matrix metalloproteinase in hyperlipidemia. Int J Cardiol. 2004 Nov;97(2):239-44. PMID: 15458690

results.title: Comparative effects of diet and statin on NO bioactivity and matrix metalloproteinases in hypercholesterolemic patients with coronary artery disease.
results.text_hl: Compared with diet alone, @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ significantly improved the percent flow-mediated dilator response to @<m>DISEASE_Hyperemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006940 @@@hyperemia@@@ from 3.37+/-2.28% to 5.89+/-2.35% (P<0.001) and lowered plasma levels of @GENE_CRP @GENE_1401 @@@C-reactive protein@@@ from 0.48 to 0.10 mg/dL (P<0.001), @GENE_TNF @GENE_7124 @@@TNF-alpha@@@ from 3.38 to 2.79 pg/mL (P<0.001), total @GENE_MMP9 @GENE_4318 @@@matrix metalloproteinase (MMP)-9@@@ from 36 to 28 ng/mL (P=0.006), and tissue inhibitor of matrix metalloproteinase-1 from 80+/-30 to 74+/-23 ng/mL (P=0.041), and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ lowered to a greater extent @GENE_MMP9 @GENE_4318 @@@MMP-9@@@ activity (from 71 to 52 ng/mL, P=0.006) and @GENE_MMP9 @GENE_4318 @@@MMP-9@@@ activity/tissue inhibitor of matrix metalloproteinase-1 ratios (P=0.018), although this difference did not reach statistical significance.

citations.NLM: Koh KK, Son JW, Ahn JY, Jin DK, Kim HS, Choi YM, Kim DS, Jeong EM, Park GS, Choi IS, Shin EK. Comparative effects of diet and statin on NO bioactivity and matrix metalloproteinases in hypercholesterolemic patients with coronary artery disease. Arterioscler Thromb Vasc Biol. 2002 Sep 1;22(9):e19-23. PMID: 12231575

results.title: Effects of statins in an indomethacin-induced gastric injury model in rats.
results.text_hl: Although the 20 mg/kg dose of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ inhibited mononuclear leukocyte infiltration, the 40 mg/kg dose induced @<m>DISEASE_Hyperemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006940 @@@hyperemia@@@.

results.title: Vascular effects of diet and statin in hypercholesterolemic patients.
results.text_hl: RESULTS: Compared with diet alone, @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ significantly improved the percent flow-mediated dilator response to @<m>DISEASE_Hyperemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006940 @@@hyperemia@@@ and lowered plasma levels of @GENE_TNF @GENE_7124 @@@tumor necrosis factor (TNF)-alpha@@@, @GENE_ICAM1 @GENE_3383 @@@intercellular adhesion molecule type-1@@@ (@GENE_ICAM1 @GENE_3383 @@@ICAM-1@@@), serum levels of @GENE_CRP @GENE_1401 @@@CRP@@@, and @GENE_FGB @GENE_2244 @@@fibrinogen@@@ (P<0.001, P<0.001, P=0.035, P<0.001 and P=0.014, respectively).

results.title: Cerebral blood flow changes after brain injury in human amyloid-beta knock-in mice.
results.text_hl: Post-@DISEASE_Wounds_and_Injuries @DISEASE_MESH:D014947 @@@injury@@@ treatment of @GENE_APP @GENE_11820 @@@Abeta@@@ transgenic @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@ with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ lowered brain @GENE_APP @GENE_11820 @@@Abeta@@@ concentrations, attenuated deficits in @DISEASE_No_Reflow_Phenomenon @DISEASE_MESH:D054318 @@@CBF@@@ ipsilateral to @DISEASE_Wounds_and_Injuries @DISEASE_MESH:D014947 @@@injury@@@, restored @<m>DISEASE_Hyperemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006940 @@@hyperemia@@@ contralateral to @DISEASE_Wounds_and_Injuries @DISEASE_MESH:D014947 @@@injury@@@, and reduced @DISEASE_Brain_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D001927 @@@brain tissue loss@@@.

results.title: Pathophysiology and a Rational Basis of Therapy.
results.text_hl: It is of note that @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ has already been proven to be clinically effective in two randomized controlled trials.
